snippet: We turn our backs on hundreds of thousands of veterans who have “bad paper” and thus do not qualify as veterans under federal law.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Iraq war veteran Phillip Carter holds nation is turning its back on hundreds of thousands of veteran who were discharged under conditions other than honorable, and who thereby do not qualify as veterans under federal law; calls for far greater discretion by commanders when trimming ranks, as bad discharges indelibly mark veterans as damaged and cost society a great deal.
lead_paragraph: We turn our backs on hundreds of thousands of veterans who have “bad paper” and thus do not qualify as veterans under federal law.

headline.main: The Vets We Reject and Ignore
headline.print_headline: The Vets We Reject And Ignore
